Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming. Okay, since that's all you need to read to celebrate our American victory over the British in the Revolutionary War...go watch this movie now.

Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There were some good fight moves in there that were kind of cool but it wasn't what I was expecting when seeing the preview and title of the movie. Unless you like a lot of dialogue and not much action, don't waste your time with this!

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as the 1978's "The Brontosaurus", starring Omar Sharif and Pea Brother. The new film erased all prudishness, as well as the wit with which Blier gave his narration.
